nodes.text: Gimer-gum was a substance. Around 232 BBY, Jedi Master Douglas Sunvale described aspiring scientist Avon Starros, who had been sent to Port Haileap, where Sunvale was marshal, by her mother, as intelligent enough to solve a problem with only gimer-gum and some bits of wire. After Sunvale's death in an attack on the starship Steady Wing, Jedi Knight Vernestra Rwoh remembered Sunvale's words while stranded on the moon Wevo. Gimer-gum shared its name with the gimer stick, a type of cane used by Jedi Grand Master Yoda.
